info.game_comments:
Roger Craig game 2.
Roger sets a new single-day cash winnings record of $77,000.

double_jeopardy_round: THEY'RE IN HOW I MET YOUR MOTHER

(1, 1).clue: Paul O. Zelinsky won the 1998 Medal for illustrating the tale of this girl who really knew how to let her hair down

(2, 1).clue: Drumroll please!  In July 2010 this Beatle turned 70

(4, 1).clue: If Train A leaves Oamaru at 9 a.m. at 70 MPH & Train B leaves Timaru at 1 p.m. going 80, this will still be New Zealand's capital

(5, 1).clue: It's the absence of any form of political authority

(6, 1).clue: (Katie Couric delivers the clue.) In 2006, on my first broadcast as anchor of the CBS Evening News, I reported that this group that formerly ruled Afghanistan was "back with a vengeance"

(1, 2).clue: The 1964 Caldecott Medal went to this classic by Maurice Sendak

(2, 2).clue: This rock pioneer who sang "Sweet Little Sixteen" in 1958 turned a sweet little 83 in 2009

(4, 2).clue: Sally has 1/3 of a 5th Avenue candy bar, Eddie has 7/8 of a Mr. Goodbar; both are made by this company

(5, 2).clue: Term for a large group or chain of islands

(6, 2).clue: (Katie Couric delivers the clue.) On "60 Minutes" in 2009 I conducted the first interview with this pilot, who vividly described "birds filling the entire windscreen"

(1, 3).clue: A 2007 Caldecott Honor book was called "Moses: When" she "Led Her People to Freedom"

(2, 3).clue: In February 2010 this wife of a Beatle turned 77

(4, 3).clue: Mr. Jenkins has 3 nickels, 13 dimes & 54 pennies; he can't afford a 2009 Phantom from this car company

(5, 3).clue: The name of this refractive defect of the eye comes from the Greek

(6, 3).clue: (Katie Couric delivers the clue.) In a 2008 foreign policy interview, I asked this candidate, "Have you ever been involved with any negotiations with the Russians?" -- it seemed like a reasonable question

(1, 4).clue: Ian Falconer received a 2001 Caldecott Honor for his tale of this mischievous girl pig

(2, 4).clue: In April 2010 this legendary sitarist celebrated his 90th birthday

(4, 4).clue: The Statue of Liberty weighs 225 tons; how many have read this woman's poem "The New Colossus" on the pedestal wall?

(5, 4).clue: Bolivia's coat of arms features this quadruped

(6, 4).clue: (Katie Couric delivers the clue.) My first network job was as deputy correspondent at this site, preparing me for interviewing the Petraeuses & Odiernos of the world

(1, 5).clue: Ludwig Bemelmans was honored for illustrating this Parisian schoolgirl who had her appendix out

(2, 5).clue: In 2006 Lubbock, Texas held a bash for what would have been this native son's 70th birthday

(4, 5).clue: Bo makes 86 snowballs in 1 3/4 hrs.; when will Bo know he has this 9-letter problem where ice crystals form in body tissues?

(5, 5).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew stands in front of a screen.) You can control the amount of light entering a camera by varying the diameter of this, which acts like the iris in the human eye

(6, 5).clue: (Katie Couric delivers the clue.) This Saudi royal was still Crown Prince when he did an exclusive interview with me in 2003; now he's king

(1, 1).clue: In 2007 Neil Patrick Harris voiced his "Mother" role, Barney, on this animated Fox show with the Griffins

(2, 1).clue: This "numerical" club on 52nd boasted Ernest Hemingway as a regular

(3, 1).clue: A suit of executive cut is for men who are a little more, how shall I say... well, you tell me

(5, 1).clue: The last time this came close to Earth was in 1986 & it's expected again as it completes its 76-year cycle

(6, 1).clue: In a Homeric epic, he's ordered home to his kingdom in Ithaca after the fall of Troy

(1, 2).clue: Before playing Robin, Cobie Smulders shared the screen with Clark, Lana & Lex on this drama

(2, 2).clue: In 2010 you could check out the "Bauhaus Lounge" exhibit at this museum on 53rd Street

(4, 2).clue: A gin from London, named for someone at the Tower of London

(5, 2).clue: This slow-moving ketchup used Carly Simon's "Anticipation" in ads

(6, 2).clue: This Greek god is told: "You are... the most hateful of gods... for dear to you always are strife and wars"

(1, 3).clue: In "I Love You, Man", Jason Segel gets put in a sleeper hold by this ex-"Incredible Hulk"

(2, 3).clue: This transport takes 60,000 people a day across the water between 2 boroughs, for free

(4, 3).clue: It partners with "& between" to mean "in an unresolved position"

(5, 3).clue: In this play, a boy says that the title character "won't come this evening, but surely tomorrow"

(6, 3).clue: In Greek myth, Zephyrus is the west this

(1, 4).clue: In 2003 Josh Radnor appeared on "ER" & this Alan Ball HBO series where you ended up if you didn't make it out of the ER

(2, 4).clue: Architect William Van Alen put radiator caps on the 31st floor of this art deco landmark at 405 Lexington

(4, 4).clue: This 9-letter area is the first objective of a military force landing on an enemy shore

(5, 4).clue: Don't delay in telling us the name of this artist whose 1882 pastel "Waiting" is seen here

(6, 4).clue: He invented the lyre & gave it to Apollo; Apollo gave him the caduceus in return

(1, 5).clue: Alyson Hannigan made "this one time, at band camp" a catchphrase in this 1999 movie comedy

(2, 5).clue: In 1942 Fiorello LaGuardia & his family moved into this building at 88th Street & East End Avenue

(4, 5).clue: It's an important step leading to canonization

(5, 5).clue: She was a lady-in-waiting to Anne Boleyn before she became the next queen

(6, 5).clue: He showed Medusa's severed head to Atlas, turning Atlas to stone

(0, 0).clue: The inspiration for this title object in a novel & a 1957 movie actually spanned the Mae Khlung River
